sentences.english: The 435 members of the House are elected every two years.
sentences.chinese: 最少每五年舉行一次普選來選舉下議院議員。

sentences.english: Universal suffrage is thus the gauge of the maturity of the working class.
sentences.chinese: 因此，普選制是測量工人階級成熟性的標尺。

sentences.english: And lastlythepossessing class rules directly by means of suffrage.
sentences.chinese: 最後，有產階級是直接通過普選制來統治的。

sentences.english: Mrs Chan's campaign platform called for full democracy in Hong Kong in 2012.
sentences.chinese: 陳太的競選綱領要求2012年香港實行普選。

sentences.english: The only really dark moment of the general election was purely personal.
sentences.chinese: 州長普選中唯一陰沉的時刻純粹是和個人有關。

sentences.english: Members are elected by popular vote to serve four-year terms.
sentences.chinese: 議會成員是由普選產生，每屆任期四年。

sentences.english: The president, elected by popular vote every five years, serves as the head of state.
sentences.chinese: 總統作爲國家元首每五年由全民普選產生。

sentences.english: According to our general understanding of the right of universal suffrage, I have no objection . . .
sentences.chinese: 按照我們對普選權的一般理解，我不反對。

sentences.english: It is elected by universal suffrage according to a system of proportional representation to multi-member constituencies.
sentences.chinese: 它是由按照一定選區一定比例的原則普選產生的。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, the danger of Nigeria plunging into postelection violence is a real possibility.
sentences.chinese: 但是，尼日利亞陷入普選後暴亂局面的可能性極大。

sentences.english: Eighty-four per cent want the whole legislature to be directly elected by 2008.
sentences.chinese: 百分之八十四的受訪者支持於二零零八年普選立法會。

sentences.english: We are winning the popular vote.
sentences.chinese: 我們在普選票數方面打了勝仗。

sentences.english: Because communications were poor it took some time to get around to all the villages and institute popular elections.
sentences.chinese: 由於交通不便，到各村開展普選就得花費一些時間。

definition: to assist in a candidate's election campaign (Tw)
within the party (esp. Chinese communist party)
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
to repeal (a law)/to put an end to/abolition/annulled
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
